ja11:1.1: Lucky Spot, the wise and prudent deer-king, kept his herd safe in their journey, while the foolish and careless Black Mark lost his whole herd.
ja11:1.3: Here, _lakkhaṇa_ has the sense “possessing beautiful or auspicious marks”, and hence “lucky”. The description fits the common Chital or “spotted” deer, who are elegant in form, gregarious, and roam in herds.
